distractors: Manage the hardware and give them power

q2.prompt: Order the memory hierarcy from fastest to slowest.
distractors: registers, main memory, cache, non-volitile memory, SDD, HDD, optical disk, magnegtic tape
non-volitile memory, SDD, HDD, optical disk, magnegtic tape, registers, main memory, cache
magnegtic tape, optical disk, HDD, SDD, non-volitile memory, main memory, cache, registers,
registers, cache, non-volitile memory, HDD, SDD, magnegtic tape, optical disk, main memory
answer: registers, cache, main memory non-volitile memory, SDD, HDD, optical disk, magnegtic tape

q49.prompt: In an Asynchronous thread execution strategy, which of the following is true?
distractors: Children threads wait for the parent thread to give a signal before starting
The parent creates a child thread then waits for a single child to complete
The parent creates child threads then chooses one child as the favorite
Children threads of the main thread create other children threads
answer: The parent creates child threads then continues execution

q57.prompt: What best describes a CPU burst?
distractors: Total amount of time a process needs to fully execute a program
CPU time equal to the duration of an OS timer
Total time spent in the ready queue
Total time for cpu and I/O processing
answer: The amount of cpu time a process needs before voluntarily stopping
